intro: Coronopus linoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved coronopus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
